page.title: 07ROCHESTER IN 1985
page.content: Rochester is quite a famous place for tourists. We have a lovely castle that was built by the Normans. You can go in and have a look and you can go right to the top. It's 25p for children and 50p for adults. We have a nice cathedral set in beautiful grounds. We have two museums, one is the Guildhall and the other is the Dickens museum. l have been to both a few times. We have a nice little town but some of the shops have a modern look to them and it spoils all the old ones. On Friday we have a big market,and restaurants and tearooms get very busy. Anybody who is passing by Rochester should come and have a look - it is a pretty town and is worth a visit. By Kate Reader St Peters and St Margarets School
